subject: Education
title: What Is Transfer of Learning?
description: A short lesson to help you apply What Is Transfer of Learning?.

hook.text: You aced the textbook problems but froze on the real-world version.

buildup.text: Transfer means applying what you learned in one context to a different one.

discovery.text: Near transfer uses similar contexts; far transfer jumps across domains.

twist.text: Far transfer is rareâ€”the brain defaults to context-dependent retrieval.

climax.text: Teaching principles, not just procedures, increases the odds of transfer.

punchline.text: Knowledge that can't travel isn't really learned.

quiz.question: Why is far transfer so difficult?
options: The brain retrieves memories in a context-dependent way
Far transfer only applies to physical skills
